PARAGRAPH.STRING: is the highest point in the state of Montana, USA.
lies within the Absaroka-Beartooth Wilderness, in Park County very near the borders of Stillwater County and Carbon County.
is 10 mi north of the Wyoming border, southwest of Columbus, Montana.
is one of the most difficult U.S. state highpoint ascents, due to technical climbing, poor weather, and route finding.
first ascent was made by Elers Koch on August 29, 1923 after several failed attempts by others.
was the last of the state highpoints to be climbed. Today, climbers typically spend two or three days ascending
, stopping over on the Froze-to-Death Plateau. However, other climbers choose to ascend

in a single day. Please be cautious at the snow bridge. a few unroped climbers have perished here. If the snow is not soft or you feel you do not have the ability to safely walk aross then you must rope up. The route before you reach the snow bridge is mostly a scramble. After it, it immediatly becomes technical rock climbing that requires extremely good route finding skills.
